lead_paragraph: President Ollanta Humala of Peru declared a state of emergency in the southern Andes on Tuesday after three people died and scores were injured in protests of a Chinese-owned copper mining project.

headline.main: Peru: Region in State of Emergency After Deadly Protests at a Mine
headline.print_headline: Peru: Region in State of Emergency After Deadly Protests at a Mine

snippet: President Ollanta Humala of Peru declared a state of emergency in the southern Andes on Tuesday after three people died and scores were injured in protests of a Chinese-owned copper mining project.
